page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Much of the block is covered with clay deposited during the ice-age. During the 19th century the clay was dug and clay-pits dotted the area. One of them surives as a wood depression on the S.E. corner of the Fairway School grounds and Rednal Rd was called Marlpit Lane until the beginning of the century. A path that leads south of Wychall lane can seen running through fields on old maps. This is now a tarmac path running though Fairway Estate known locally as the Black Path In places its old borader hedges still fourish. Some field boundaries are still traceable due to surviving hedges and trees. Field and farm names have also surived e.g. Staple Lodge Rd (from a farm and cottage) and Banktop Farmhouse is still standing Road names also show that the land covered by Fairway Estate was a golf course.
